description.para: Configure the tower grid with individual parameters

simplesect.para: Invoking the configureGrid method is mandatory to set up a valid tower grid, if the CaloTowerContainer_v1 is constructed with the default constructor.
This method will internally invoke CaloTowerContainer_v1::configureGrid() method.

memberdef.argsstring: (int nEtaBins, double etaMin, double etaMax, int nPhiBins)
memberdef.name: configureGrid

description.para: Returns the nominal number of towers

briefdescription.para: Default constructor Constructs a tower container without structure (binning) or content. The configureGrid method has to be called after this container is instantiated and an auxiliary store is assigned.

detaileddescription.para: Arguments correspond to the DataVector constructor:

parameterdescription.para: ownership policy tag (default owns its elements)

memberdef.argsstring: (int nEtaBins, double etaMin, double etaMax, int nPhiBins, SG::OwnershipPolicy ownPolicy=SG::OWN_ELEMENTS, SG::IndexTrackingPolicy trackIndices=SG::DEFAULT_TRACK_INDICES)
memberdef.name: CaloTowerContainer_v1

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a configured CaloTowerContainer_v1 object with tower grid parameters

simplesect.para: Invoking the CaloTowerContainer_v1::configureGrid method will do nothing - the tower grid cannot be overwritten when using this constructor.

parameterdescription.para: ownership policy tag (default owns its elements)

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor used by POOL converter (allows also shallow copies) Constructs a view-container and copies the metadata.
Basic container storing all information need for xAOD::CaloTower_v1 objects.

detaileddescription.para: This container does not only provide the store for CaloTower_v1 object, but also all meta-data needed to provide the tower grid and kinematics. The tower grid is defined in terms of pseudorapidity ($ \eta $) and azimuth ($ \phi $). In this it follows the CaloCell direction descriptors. As calorimeter towers represented by xAOD::CaloTower_v1 objects are by definition massless, any four-momentum representation extracted from a calorimeter tower (a bin in tower grid specified by this container) yields $ y = \eta $ for rapidity $ y $.

There is no need to rebuild this container event-by-event, because the direction of any given tower never changes, only its energy content; the direction is related to the tower's index in the container.
